data.question: What is the molecular weight of the spherical complex 2c?
How does the solubility of nile red change in the presence of complexes 2a, 2b, and 2c?
data.answer: The solubility of nile red is enhanced in the order 2a < 2b < 2c.

data.question: What method was used to confirm the [M12L24] composition of complexes 2a-c?
What was the purpose of diluting the DMSO solutions with water in the inclusion of nile red in spheres 2a-c?
What change in the experimental setup was made to expel nile red from the core of 2a-c into the bulk solvent?
data.answer: The polarity of the solvent was reduced by diluting with CH3CN, a less polar solvent.

data.question: What was the estimated number of nile red molecules encapsulated in sphere 2b?
What was the effect of varying the length of the pendant alkyl chains on the nature of the hydrophobic interior?
data.answer: The nature of the hydrophobic interior could be simply tuned by varying the length of the pendant alkyl chains.

data.question: What is the relationship between the length of alkyl chains in complexes 2a-c and their ability to solubilize hydrophobic guests?
data.answer: The ability to solubilize hydrophobic guests increases with the length of the alkyl chains in complexes 2a-c.

data.question: Why were amphiphilic ligands designed with inner alkyl chains and outer quaternary ammonium groups?
data.answer: To form a localized hydrophobic phase with the alkyl chains and increase the solubility of the spheres in polar media with the outer ammonium groups.

data.question: How does the solvatochromism of nile red reflect the polarity of the complexes 2a-c?
data.answer: The solvatochromism, showing bathochromic shifts in nonpolar media, directly reflects the reduction in the polarity of the complexes.

data.question: What was the purpose of performing X-ray crystallographic analysis on complex 2b?
data.answer: To reveal the rigid shell framework of the [M12L24] complexes.

data.question: How was the structure of the disordered alkyl chain segments determined?
data.answer: The disordered alkyl chain segments were modeled separately and attached to the crystal structure of the shell, then optimized through simulated annealing by molecular dynamics calculations.

data.question: What indicates that the hydrophobic nature of the complexes can be precisely tuned?
data.answer: The fact that the shape and size of the hydrophobic phases are uniform and can be analyzed by crystallographic methods.

data.question: The spherical complexes 2a-c contain exactly 24 interior alkyl chains. True or False?
The solubility of nile red in solutions of 2a-c in DMSO/H2O (1:1) is lower than in pure DMSO. True or False?
The maximum absorption wavelength of nile red undergoes a hypsochromic shift in the order of 2a < 2b < 2c. True or False?
The spherical complexes were prepared by treating ligands with Pd(NO3)2 in deuterated dimethyl sulfoxide at room temperature. True or False?
The solubility and solvatochromatic behavior of nile red do not vary with the length of the alkyl chains in complexes 2a-c. True or False?
The spherical complexes 2a-c were confirmed to have a [M12L24] composition by UV/Vis spectroscopy. True or False?
The spherical complexes 2a-c are capable of solubilizing hydrophobic guests due to their hydrophobic interior. True or False?
